alert.note: Alert for Clark (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 5:46PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Nevada, including the following county, Clark. Cottonwood Cove and Cottonwood Cove Road is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. * WHEN...Until 845 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 545 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Cottonwood Cove and Cottonwood Cove Road. Up to 0.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Cottonwood Cove and Cottonwood Cove Road is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Cottonwood Cove Campground and Cottonwood Cove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
